Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Among non - users of aspirin , the adjusted hazard ratios ( 95 % confidence interval ) of hospitalization for AMI / GI vs the acetaminophen ( with no aspirin ) group were : rofecoxib 1 . 27 ( 1 . 13 , 1 . 42 ) , celecoxib 0 . 93 ( 0 . 83 , 1 . 03 ) , naproxen 1 . 59 ( 1 . 31 , 1 . 93 ) , diclofenac 1 . 17 ( 0 . 99 , 1 . 38 ) and ibuprofen 1 . 05 ( 0 . 74 , 1 . 51 ) .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Acetaminophen group |
| AMI (Acute Myocardial Infarction) |
| GI (Gastrointestinal) |

The paragraph mentions "hospitalization for AMI / GI," which refers to Acute Myocardial Infarction (AMI) and Gastrointestinal (GI) diseases. The other entities in the paragraph, rofecoxib, celecoxib, naproxen, diclofenac, ibuprofen, and acetaminophen, are medications and not diseases.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Acute Myocardial Infarction (AMI) |
| Gastrointestinal (GI) |

The paragraph mentions "hospitalization for AMI / GI," which refers to Acute Myocardial Infarction (AMI) and Gastrointestinal (GI) diseases. These are the only entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to diseases. The other entities mentioned, rofecoxib, celecoxib, naproxen, diclofenac, ibuprofen, and acetaminophen, are medications.
